TEXT: The applicant , Mr Aage Slots , is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The respondent Government are represented by their agent , PERSON Holst - Christensen of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant owned a certain real estate in GPE and furthermore controlled , through incorporated companies , a number of wine and tobacco businesses . CARDINAL of the companies for which the applicant stood surety experienced financial difficulties and was eventually declared bankrupt . The applicant ’s personal financial situation was affected thereby and on CARDINAL DATE the customs authorities requested ORG ( Sø- og PERSON skifteretsafdeling ) to open bankruptcy proceedings against him . A number of court sessions were subsequently held following which the applicant was declared bankrupt by decision of CARDINAL DATE . Furthermore , the ORG appointed , provisionally , CARDINAL official receivers .
The applicant appealed against the above decision to ORG ( Højesteret ) . However , on DATE ORG of ORG ( ORG Anke- og kæremålsudvalg ) upheld the decision .

On DATE ORG appointed CARDINAL official receivers to sort out the applicant ’s estate in bankruptcy and to settle the accounts . A total of CARDINAL court sessions were subsequently held DATE with a view to determine the applicant ’s assets , to decide on the applicant ’s objections to the sale of real property , mortgage deeds and stocks , his objections to a manager who was temporarily hired to take care of the ongoing business , his objections to one of the official receivers and to an assisting judge , to decide on the applicant ’s request to have a counsel appointed , to consider the creditor claims submitted , to discuss accountant fees , and to settle other disputes related to the bankruptcy . During sessions held on DATE and DATE as well as on DATE the official ORG draft accounts were discussed . The applicant had objections to CARDINAL items listed in the accounts . Eventually , as no agreement could be reached , ORG approved the accounts including the fees to be paid to the official receivers and the principles of distribution by decision of DATE . It appears from the transcript of the decision that a few questions were left open regarding some amounts , which the official receivers had not been able to recover . ORG stated that if it should prove necessary , these questions could be dealt with later pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Konkursloven ) .

On DATE the applicant , represented by a lawyer , appealed to ORG against the part of ORG decision that concerned the official ORG fees which the applicant claimed reduced . Written pleadings were submitted and a court session was held DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer informed the court that he withdrew from the case . CARDINAL court sessions were held DATE and DATE during which a new lawyer represented the applicant . On DATE a final hearing was scheduled to take place on DATE . However , on DATE the new lawyer informed the court that he had withdrawn from the case . On DATE and CARDINAL October CARDINAL the case was adjourned awaiting the applicant engaging another lawyer . In a court session on DATE the final hearing was re - scheduled to take place on DATE though the applicant had had not succeeded in finding a new lawyer . Pre - trial hearings were held on DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The scheduled final hearing on DATE had to be adjourned due to the applicant ’s hospitalisation . On DATE the final hearing was re - scheduled to take place on CARDINAL DATE . However , also this hearing had to be adjourned due to the applicant ’s hospitalisation and the final hearing was re - scheduled to take place on DATE . On DATE ORG pronounced judgment upholding ORG decision of DATE concerning the fees to the official receivers .

Subsequently , supplementary income accrued to the estate . Accordingly , pursuant to LAW , on DATE the official receivers submitted an additional draft account as well as an additional statement of distribution . ORG inserted a notice , which was published in the NORP Official Gazette on DATE , summoning to a final hearing on DATE and stating :

“ The additional draft account and the list of distribution can be examined in ORG during a period of DATE before the final hearing . Provided that the drafts are approved of , and not appealed against within the time limit , the bankruptcy proceedings are terminated ... and the distribution of the dividend will take place on CARDINAL DATE . ”
By decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG approved the additional draft account and the additional statement of distribution . It follows inter alia of the court records :
“ A notice of the completion of the bankruptcy proceedings is to be published in the NORP Official Gazette .
The bankruptcy proceedings are terminated . ”
Thus , ORG inserted a notice , which was published in the NORP Official Gazette on CARDINAL DATE stating :
“ By decision of DATE ORG approved the additional draft account and the additional statement of distribution in the bankruptcy proceedings concerning [ the applicant ] . ”
On DATE , the applicant appealed against this decision to ORG of Eastern Denmark ( PERSON ) opposing to the principles of distribution .

DATE a dispute concerning the fee to be paid to ORG for the applicant ’s appeal was determined . Subsequently , written pleadings on the merits were submitted . In a court session held on DATE the applicant ’s request for an expert opinion was refused . It appears that the applicant thereafter changed lawyer CARDINAL times . At a pre - trial hearing on CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal since neither the applicant nor a representative appeared . However , at a court session held on DATE it was established that the applicant by mistake had not been informed by his lawyer of the court session on CARDINAL DATE . Accordingly , ORG restored the case . On DATE the proceedings were transferred to preparation in writing and adjourned until DATE pending the applicant ’s written pleadings . On DATE the final pleadings were scheduled to take place on DATE . By judgment pronounced on DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal for the following reasons :

“ The principles of distribution became final by ORG decision of DATE . ORG decision now appealed against [ by the applicant ] only approves an additional statement of distribution to the creditors according to the aforesaid principles .
Accordingly , [ the applicant ] is now precluded from appealing against the principles of distribution . ”

By letters of DATE and DATE the applicant requested the official receivers to inform him when the final closure of the bankruptcy estate was to take place . It appears that he did not receive a reply thereon .
B. Relevant domestic law
The relevant provisions of LAW of LAW concerning the completion of bankruptcy proceedings and the distribution of dividend read as follows :
